revised_title: A Study of the Forms Assumed by Drops and Vortices of a Gelatinising Liquid in Various Coagulating Solutions
tldr: The author investigates the forms assumed by drops and vortices of a gelatinising liquid in various coagulating solutions, finding that the density of the solution and the concentration of the gelatin sol must be carefully regulated to achieve symmetrical, permanent configurations. The study reveals various forms resembling organic structures, with shrinkage and imbibition causing modifications to the smooth surfaces of the vortices.
